Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as da422760f1e3e7ef508df484cbb25c1e88b91313

Please add "meta-facebook: yosemite4" for all Yv4 commits.

"Support functionality for" is superfluous.

Suggest: "meta-facebook: yosemite4: control NIC main/aux mode"
Done
This is strange that we have this variable and we have to have extra recipes?  We should probably look to get this refactored.  (see my comments in the policy recipe)
Ack
Done

How does a single i2ctransfer control multiple NICs?  Can we get some comments in here?

(systemd.service files allow either # or ; as comment indicators)
Done

Uh... are *both* of these service files really something we want to run in multi-user.target?  That is surprising.  I assume we do not want to change the mode in a BMC reboot scenario, do we?

Shouldn't these two service files have a Conflicts with each other?
Done, deleted.

Isn't there something like a SYSTEMD_SERVICES variable that does most of this work for you, rather than having to install all the services one at a time?  There is a lot of repetition in this bbappend.
Done
Done
Done

These extra config files seem a little strange to me.  We should talk to whoever the maintainers of phosphor-dbus-monitor are, but I would suggest we add a variable to phosphor-dbus-monitor_git.bb like "DBUS_MONITOR_CONFIGS" and have that recipe automatically install them all.   We can then just have a single bbappend for phosphor-dbus-monitor.
This might led to ```phosphor-dbus-monitor-config``` be merged into ```phosphor-dbus-monitor```, but I think I need to do some research for it, will update it later.
I think this should be a seperate commit to refactor the recipes, this commit can focus on the feature we plan to support.
Please leave a comment as to what this is achieving, why it is there, etc.

This enables the feature of dbus-monitor, which is defined in ```meta-phosphor/classes/obmc-phosphor-image.bbclass```, otherwise the dbus-monitor won't be installed to bmc image.

Normally, this should be added in obmc-phosphor-image.bbappend (E.g., ```meta-ibm/recipes-phosphor/images/obmc-phosphor-image.bbappend```).

In meta-facebook, it needs to be added to ```recipes-phosphor/images/fb-${MACHINE}-phosphor-image.inc``` in project layer.
When I say "leave a comment", I generally mean here in the code, so when we read through the code we know why we're adding a feature.
Done
Hi Patrick, thanks for all the advice you gave, and sorry for my negligence, this should be an WIP, but I will still modify the code based on the suggestion.
The requirement of changing NIC's power status has revised. Now NIC 1 targets to Host slot1 and slot2, NIC 2 targets to Host slot3 and slot4. The detail has explained in commit message.

Since this recipe did not have explictly install `phosphor-dbus-monitor.service`, if there are extra services are install in project layer, `phosphor-dbus-monitor.service` would not be installed.

The root case can refer to `meta-phosphor/classes/obmc-phosphor-systemd.bbclass`, Line 217~219:
```
pn = d.getVar('PN', True)
if d.getVar('SYSTEMD_SERVICE:%s' % pn, True) is None:
    d.setVar('SYSTEMD_SERVICE:%s' % pn, '%s.service' % pn)
```
The design has changed, monitor CurrentHostState instead.
Why did we write this?  This is that file.

From the previous suggestion you gave, I added some comments to explain the reason for adding IMAGE_FEATURE:append, I think the first 2 lines of statements is enough.
```
# This enables the feature of dbus-monitor which defined in
# `meta-phosphor/classes/obmc-phosphor-images.bbclass`
```

I've removed the rest of them, please let me know if you have any other suggestions.
For showing on your Dashboard, I marked this as resolved here, thanks.
This needs to be a separate commit if it is appropriate.

Done, contributed as a seperate commit: https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/openbmc/+/71073

Can refer to the relation chain of this commit.
